31/** @file drm_dma.c
32 * Support code for DMA buffer management.
33 *
34 * The implementation used to be significantly more complicated, but the
35 * complexity has been moved into the drivers as different buffer management
36 * schemes evolved.
37 */
38
39#include "drmP.h"
40
41int drm_dma_setup(struct drm_device *dev)
42{
43
44 dev->dma = malloc(sizeof(*dev->dma), DRM_MEM_DRIVER, M_NOWAIT | M_ZERO);
45 if (dev->dma == NULL)
46 return ENOMEM;
47
48 DRM_SPININIT(&dev->dma_lock, "drmdma");
49
50 return 0;
51}
52
53void drm_dma_takedown(struct drm_device *dev)
54{
55 drm_device_dma_t *dma = dev->dma;
56 int i, j;
57
58 if (dma == NULL)
59 return;
60
61 /* Clear dma buffers */
62 for (i = 0; i <= DRM_MAX_ORDER; i++) {
63 if (dma->bufs[i].seg_count) {
64 DRM_DEBUG("order %d: buf_count = %d,"
65 " seg_count = %d\n", i, dma->bufs[i].buf_count,
66 dma->bufs[i].seg_count);
67 for (j = 0; j < dma->bufs[i].seg_count; j++) {
68 drm_pci_free(dev, dma->bufs[i].seglist[j]);
69 }
70 if (dma->bufs[i].seglist)
71 free(dma->bufs[i].seglist, DRM_MEM_SEGS);
72 }
73
74 if (dma->bufs[i].buf_count) {
75 for (j = 0; j < dma->bufs[i].buf_count; j++) {
76 free(dma->bufs[i].buflist[j].dev_private,
77 DRM_MEM_BUFS);
78 }
79 if (dma->bufs[i].buflist)
80 free(dma->bufs[i].buflist, DRM_MEM_BUFS);
81 }
82 }
83
84 if (dma->buflist)
85 free(dma->buflist, DRM_MEM_BUFS);
86 if (dma->pagelist)
87 free(dma->pagelist, DRM_MEM_PAGES);
88 if (dev->dma)
89 free(dev->dma, DRM_MEM_DRIVER);
90 dev->dma = NULL;
91 DRM_SPINUNINIT(&dev->dma_lock);
92}
93
94
95void drm_free_buffer(struct drm_device *dev, drm_buf_t *buf)
96{
97 if (!buf)
98 return;
99
100 buf->pending = 0;
101 buf->file_priv= NULL;
102 buf->used = 0;
103}
104
105void drm_reclaim_buffers(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file_priv)
106{
107 drm_device_dma_t *dma = dev->dma;
108 int i;
109
110 if (!dma)
111 return;
112
113 for (i = 0; i < dma->buf_count; i++) {
114 if (dma->buflist[i]->file_priv == file_priv) {
115 switch (dma->buflist[i]->list) {
116 case DRM_LIST_NONE:
117 drm_free_buffer(dev, dma->buflist[i]);
118 break;
119 case DRM_LIST_WAIT:
120 dma->buflist[i]->list = DRM_LIST_RECLAIM;
121 break;
122 default:
123 /* Buffer already on hardware. */
124 break;
125 }
126 }
127 }
128}
129
130/* Call into the driver-specific DMA handler */
131int drm_dma(struct drm_device *dev, void *data, struct drm_file *file_priv)
132{
133
134 if (dev->driver->dma_ioctl) {
135 /* shared code returns -errno */
136 return -dev->driver->dma_ioctl(dev, data, file_priv);
137 } else {
138 DRM_DEBUG("DMA ioctl on driver with no dma handler\n");
139 return EINVAL;
140 }
141}
